definition: down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels

sentences.english: He could hear two men walking around the Upper Library, dusting the bookshelves with fly- whisks .
sentences.chinese: 只听得两个人走进书房，挥拂尘四下里拂拭。

sentences.english: I stepped into the bedroom and looked around, but there seemed to be nothing out of the ordinary.
sentences.chinese: 我走进卧室，朝四下里张望，没看见有什么异常。

sentences.english: I should scarcely have known you: you look like a lady now.
sentences.chinese: 然后她就四下里望着想找希刺克厉夫。

sentences.english: It was deathly silent in the little temple, which was apparently uninhabited except for this one old monk.
sentences.chinese: 四下里万籁无声，这小庙中似乎就只这个老僧。

sentences.english: She looked desperately around for a weapon.
sentences.chinese: 她在四下里找，急于弄到一件武器。

sentences.english: Small white into the warehouse, and immediately shrink starting from a neck looked around to find.
sentences.chinese: 小白猫进了库房，立刻缩起自个的脖子四下里寻找。

sentences.english: Flora heard somebody shouting. She looked around and saw Jeff running.
sentences.chinese: 弗罗拉听见有人在喊，他四下里张望，发现杰夫在跑。

sentences.english: For the first time, he feels the urge to look around him.
sentences.chinese: 第一次，他感觉到强烈的愿望要四下里看看。

sentences.english: Perhaps because it was dark, he didn't recognize where he was at all.
sentences.chinese: 也许是因为四下里太黑了，他辨不清自己身在何处。

sentences.english: Crowds of people plodded around in yellow plastic raincoats.
sentences.chinese: 一群群身穿黄色塑料雨衣的人在四下里吃力地走着。

sentences.english: They basely fly and dare not stay the field.
sentences.chinese: 便四下里乱逃乱蹿，不敢再留在战场上。

sentences.english: Doorman : what also can't see, he only looks.
sentences.chinese: 看门人什么也看不清，只得四下里胡乱摸索。

sentences.english: I gazed round for a means of diverting her thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 我向四下里呆望着，想办法岔开她的思想。

sentences.english: Armstrong looked round at his classmates, silly glee in profile.
sentences.chinese: 阿姆斯特朗四下里打量着同学们，露出傻笑的侧影。

definition: to look around/to peep (through a crack)/to peer at/to throw a look at
to take a furtive look at
pitch-black/(fig.) to be completely in the dark
to stick one's head out and look around (idiom)
